page.title: 09Transport
page.content: There are two principle roads in this area. The A.915 runs from Kirkcaldy through the area to Windygates. The A.955 parallels the A.915 and serves the villages of East Wemyss, Coaltown of Wemyss and Buckhaven. The A.915 is known as the Standing Stone Road because it passes close to a number of standing stones. There are four bus services which run on the A.915 linking the villages with the five major surounding centres; Dundee, Leven, Kirkcaldy, Dunfermline and Edinburgh. There are also a further two services which run along the A.955 providing a slightly quicker service between Kirkcaldy and Dundee than the coastal route. Car owner ship is low so there is a high dependance on public transport. Links with the motorway network are poor,thus causing some isolation.
